text: ਸੁਖ ਸਾਗਰੁ ਸੁਰਤਰ ਚਿੰਤਾਮਨਿ ਕਾਮਧੇਨੁ ਬਸਿ ਜਾ ਕੇ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He is the ocean of peace; the miraculous tree of life, the wish-fulfilling jewel, and the Kaamadhayna, the cow which fulfills all desires, all are in His power.

transliteration.text: sukh sāgar suratar chintāman kāmadhēn bas jā kē .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

text: ਚਾਰਿ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਅਸਟ ਦਸਾ ਸਿਧਿ ਨਵ ਨਿਧਿ ਕਰ ਤਲ ਤਾ ਕੇ ॥੧॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The four great blessings, the eighteen supernatural spiritual powers of the Siddhas, and the nine treasures, are all in the palm of His hand. ||1||

transliteration.text: chār padārath asat dasā sidh nav nidh kar tal tā kē .1.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

text: ਹਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਹਰਿ ਨ ਜਪਹਿ ਰਸਨਾ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You do not chant with your tongue the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, Har.

transliteration.text: har har har n japah rasanā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

text: ਅਵਰ ਸਭ ਤਿਆਗਿ ਬਚਨ ਰਚਨਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Abandon your involvement in all other words. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: avar sabh tiāg bachan rachanā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

text: ਨਾਨਾ ਖਿਆਨ ਪੁਰਾਨ ਬੇਦ ਬਿਧਿ ਚਉਤੀਸ ਅਖਰ ਮਾਂਹੀ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The various Shaastras, Puranaas, and the Vedas of Brahma, are made up of thirty-four letters.

transliteration.text: nānā khiān purān bēd bidh chautīs akhar mānhhī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

text: ਬਿਆਸ ਬਿਚਾਰਿ ਕਹਿਓ ਪਰਮਾਰਥੁ ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਸਰਿ ਨਾਹੀ ॥੨॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: After deep contemplation, Vyaas spoke of the supreme objective; there is nothing equal to the Lord's Name. ||2||

transliteration.text: biās bichār kahiō paramārath rām nām sar nāhī .2.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

text: ਸਹਜ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਉਪਾਧਿ ਰਹਤ ਫੁਨਿ ਬਡੈ ਭਾਗਿ ਲਿਵ ਲਾਗੀ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Very fortunate are those who are absorbed in celestial bliss, and released from their entanglements; they are lovingly attached to the Lord.

transliteration.text: sahaj samādh upādh rahat phun badai bhāg liv lāgī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

text: ਕਹਿ ਰਵਿਦਾਸ ਪ੍ਰਗਾਸੁ ਰਿਦੈ ਧਰਿ ਜਨਮ ਮਰਨ ਭੈ ਭਾਗੀ ॥੩॥੪॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Ravi Daas, enshrine the Lord's Light within your heart, and your fear of birth and death shall run away from you. ||3||4||

transliteration.text: kah ravidās pragās ridai dhar janam maran bhai bhāgī .3.4.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.
